2503.07202.title: A Zero-shot Learning Method Based on Large Language Models for Multi-modal Knowledge Graph Embedding
2503.07202.paper_summary:
Zero-shot learning (ZL) is crucial for tasks involving unseen categories,
such as natural language processing, image classification, and cross-lingual
transfer. Current applications often fail to accurately infer and handle new
relations or entities involving unseen categories, severely limiting their
scalability and practicality in open-domain scenarios. ZL learning faces the
challenge of effectively transferring semantic information of unseen categories
in multi-modal knowledge graph (MMKG) embedding representation learning. In
this paper, we propose ZSLLM, a framework for zero-shot embedding learning of
MMKGs using large language models (LLMs). We leverage textual modality
information of unseen categories as prompts to fully utilize the reasoning
capabilities of LLMs, enabling semantic information transfer across different
modalities for unseen categories. Through model-based learning, the embedding
representation of unseen categories in MMKG is enhanced. Extensive experiments
conducted on multiple real-world datasets demonstrate the superiority of our
approach compared to state-of-the-art methods.
2503.07202.paper_summary_zh: 零樣本學習 (ZL) 對於涉及未見類別的任務至關重要，例如自然語言處理、圖像分類和跨語言遷移。目前的應用程序通常無法準確推斷和處理涉及未見類別的新關係或實體，這嚴重限制了它們在開放域場景中的可擴展性和實用性。ZL 學習面臨著在多模態知識圖譜 (MMKG) 嵌入表示學習中有效傳遞未見類別語義信息的挑戰。在本文中，我們提出了 ZSLLM，一個使用大型語言模型 (LLM) 進行 MMKG 零樣本嵌入學習的框架。我們利用未見類別的文本模態信息作為提示，充分利用 LLM 的推理能力，實現跨不同模態的未見類別語義信息傳遞。通過基於模型的學習，增強了 MMKG 中未見類別的嵌入表示。在多個真實世界數據集上進行的大量實驗證明了我們的方法相較於最先進方法的優越性。
